text.text:
5 mins to start <https://gcc2021.sched.com/event/ihqG/emea-apac-session-8|Session 8> with these superb talks:

- Quantitative Metaproteomics using Galaxy Platform: Measuring Functional Microbiome via Data-Dependent and Data-Independent Acquisition Mass Spec, Pratik Jagtap, Subina Mehta
- A Galaxy-based evaluation of optimal peptide targets for MS-based detection of SARS-CoV-2 in clinical samples, Andrew T Rajcewski
- MaxQuant and MSstats in Galaxy enable reproducible quantitative high-throughput proteomics for everyone, Melanie Föll
- Peptide mass spectrometry imaging of pancreatic cancers – A data analysis workflow in Galaxy, Maren Stillger
- XIMG-CHESS: a Galaxy based Science Gateway for X-ray Diffraction Imaging and Microstructure Modeling, Jorge Vinals
- Muon Galaxy – extending Galaxy for muon science, Eli Chadwick

Captions for individual talks can be accessed with the [CC] icon on the video.
